# Updating to the last version of vegtable

- [Updating to the last version of
  vegtable](#updating-to-the-last-version-of-vegtable)
- [Some examples](#some-examples)
- [Further readings](#further-readings)

The aim of `vegtable` is to provide a way for handling databases stored
in [Turboveg](http://www.synbiosys.alterra.nl/turboveg). This package
incorporates many concepts and some functions included in the package
[vegdata](https://cran.r-project.org/package=vegdata) but defining an
homonymous `S4` class containing all elements of a database in just one
object. The package `vegtable` also contains several methods for this
object class.

Species lists in `vegtable` objects are handled by the package
[taxlist](https://github.com/kamapu/taxlist), thus I will recommend to
take a look on it.

This package has been developed as a tool handling data stored in
[SWEA-Dataveg](http://www.givd.info/ID/AF-00-006). Further development
is running in the context of the project
[GlobE-wetlands](https://www.wetlands-africa.de/).

An important source of inspiration for `vegtable` have been the
enthusiastic discussions during several versions of the [Meetings on
Vegetation
Databases](http://www.hswt.de/person/joerg-ewald/vegetationsdatenbanken.md).

The very first step is to install the package
[devtools](https://github.com/hadley/devtools) and dependencies. Then
you just need to execute following commands in your R-session:

``` r
library(devtools)
install_github("kamapu/vegtable")
```

# Some examples

The current version of `vegtable` includes an example data, which
corresponds to a subset from
[SWEA-Dataveg](http://www.givd.info/ID/AF-00-006). This data set
contains plot observations done in Kenya imported from 5 sources.

``` r
library(vegtable)
#> Loading required package: taxlist
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'taxlist'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     levels, levels<-, print
data(Kenya_veg)

# validate and explore
validObject(Kenya_veg)
#> [1] TRUE
summary(Kenya_veg)
#> ## Metadata 
#>    db_name: Sweadataveg
#>    sp_list: Easplist
#>    dictionary: Swea
#>    object size: 9501 Kb 
#>    validity: TRUE 
#> 
#> ## Content 
#>    number of plots: 1946 
#>    plots with records: 1946 
#>    variables in header: 34 
#>    number of relations: 3 
#> 
#> ## Taxonomic List 
#>    taxon names: 3164 
#>    taxon concepts: 2392 
#>    validity: TRUE
```

Among others, the object contains plot observations done in the Aberdare
National Park (Kenya) by **Schmitt (1991)**. We can make a subset
including the plots classified by the mentioned author into the
*Juniperus procera*-*Podocarpus latifolius* community (IDs 780 to 798).

``` r
JPcomm <- subset(Kenya_veg, ReleveID %in% c(780:798))
summary(JPcomm)
#> ## Metadata 
#>    db_name: Sweadataveg
#>    sp_list: Easplist
#>    dictionary: Swea
#>    object size: 717.4 Kb 
#>    validity: TRUE 
#> 
#> ## Content 
#>    number of plots: 19 
#>    plots with records: 19 
#>    variables in header: 17 
#>    number of relations: 3 
#> 
#> ## Taxonomic List 
#>    taxon names: 3164 
#>    taxon concepts: 2392 
#>    validity: TRUE
```

If you have geo-referenced plot observations, you can use the
coordinates to produce a map of the distribution of your plots by using
the package `leaflet`.

``` r
library(leaflet)
leaflet(JPcomm@header) %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addCircleMarkers(
    lng = ~LONGITUDE, lat = ~LATITUDE, color = "red",
    opacity = 0.3, radius = 1
  )
```

# Further readings

- [Basics on the work with vegetation-plots in
  vegtable](https://kamapu.github.io/posts/vegtable-press-2/)
- [Introduction to the package
  vegtable](https://kamapu.github.io/posts/vegtable-intro/)
- [vegtable: An R object for vegetation-plot data
  sets](https://kamapu.github.io/posts/2020-10-29-vegtablepress/)

# Package index

## All functions

- [`` `$`( ``*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Extract.md)
  [`` `$<-`( ``*`<vegtable>`*`,`*`<ANY>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Extract.md)
  [`` `$`( ``*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Extract.md)
  [`` `[`( ``*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Extract.md)
  [`` `$<-`( ``*`<coverconvert>`*`,`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Extract.md)
  [`` `[`( ``*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Extract.md)
  [`` `[<-`( ``*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Extract.md)
  : Select or replace elements in objects
- [`Kenya_veg`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Kenya_veg-data.md)
  : Vegetation-plots from Kenya
- [`Wetlands`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/Wetlands-data.md)
  : Vegetation-plots from Tanzania
- [`add_releves()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/add_releves.md)
  [`` `add_releves<-`() ``](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/add_releves.md)
  : Merge relevÃ©s from data frames into vegtable objects
- [`aspect_conv`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/aspect_conv-data.md)
  : Conversion of aspect classes to azimuth
- [`braun_blanquet`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/braun_blanquet-data.md)
  : Conversion of Braun-Blanquet codes to cover percentage
- [`clean_once()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/clean.md)
  [`clean(`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/clean.md)
  : Clean orphaned records in vegtable object
- [`as.list(`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/coerce-methods.md)
  [`as.list(`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/coerce-methods.md)
  : Coerce objects to lists
- [`count_taxa(`*`<vegtable>`*`,`*`<missing>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/count_taxa.md)
  [`count_taxa(`*`<formula>`*`,`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/count_taxa.md)
  [`` `count_taxa<-`() ``](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/count_taxa.md)
  : Count taxa included in vegtable objects
- [`cover_trans(`*`<character>`*`,`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/cover_trans.md)
  [`cover_trans(`*`<factor>`*`,`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/cover_trans.md)
  [`cover_trans(`*`<numeric>`*`,`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/cover_trans.md)
  [`cover_trans(`*`<vegtable>`*`,`*`<missing>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/cover_trans.md)
  : Convert cover scales to percent cover
- [`coverconvert`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/coverconvert.md)
  [`coverconvert-class`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/coverconvert.md)
  : Cover conversion tables
- [`crosstable()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/crosstable.md)
  [`cross2db()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/crosstable.md)
  : Generating cross tables from database lists
- [`df2coverconvert()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/df2coverconvert.md)
  : Create coverconvert objects
- [`df2vegtable()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/df2vegtable.md)
  : Convert a data frame into a vegtable object.
- [`dune_veg`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/dune_veg-data.md)
  : Dutch dune meadows as vegtable
- [`header()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/header.md)
  [`` `header<-`() ``](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/header.md)
  : Retrieve or replace slot header in vegtable objects
- [`layers2samples()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/layers2samples.md)
  : Add information from slot 'layers' into slot 'samples'
- [`set_group()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/make_cocktail.md)
  [`set_pseudo()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/make_cocktail.md)
  [`set_formula()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/make_cocktail.md)
  [`make_cocktail()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/make_cocktail.md)
  : Produce a Cocktail classification
- [`names(`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/names.md)
  [`dimnames(`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/names.md)
  [`names(`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/names.md)
  [`` `names<-`( ``*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/names.md)
  : Retrieve names of vegtable and coverconvert objects
- [`new_layer()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/new_layer.md)
  [`` `new_layer<-`() ``](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/new_layer.md)
  : Insert new classification of vegetation layers
- [`new_relation()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/new_relation.md)
  [`` `new_relation<-`() ``](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/new_relation.md)
  : Insert a new variable as relation in vegtable object
- [`relation2header()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/relation2heder.md)
  : Insert variables from relations into header
- [`shaker-class`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/shaker-class.md)
  [`shaker`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/shaker-class.md)
  : Class containing Cocktail algorithms.
- [`subset(`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/subset.md)
  : Subset functions for vegtable objects
- [`summary(`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  [`summary(`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  [`summary(`*`<shaker>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  [`show(`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  [`print(`*`<vegtable>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  [`show(`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  [`print(`*`<coverconvert>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  [`show(`*`<shaker>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  [`print(`*`<shaker>`*`)`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/summary.md)
  : Summary method for vegtable objects
- [`taxa2samples()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/taxa2samples.md)
  : Insert taxon information into samples
- [`trait_stats()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/trait_stats.md)
  [`trait_proportion()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/trait_stats.md)
  : Statistics and proportion for taxon traits
- [`tv2vegtable()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/tv2vegtable.md)
  [`tv2coverconvert()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/tv2vegtable.md)
  : Import of vegetation data from Turboveg databases
- [`update_det()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/update_det.md)
  : Update by determined specimens
- [`used_synonyms()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/used_synonyms.md)
  [`used_concepts()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/used_synonyms.md)
  : Retrieve synonyms or taxon concepts used in a data set
- [`veg_aggregate()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_aggregate.md)
  : Aggregating information into a data frame
- [`shannon()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_diversity.md)
  [`evenness()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_diversity.md)
  [`dominance()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_diversity.md)
  [`simpson()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_diversity.md)
  [`richness()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_diversity.md)
  [`veg_diversity()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_diversity.md)
  : Calculation of statistics at plot level
- [`veg_layers`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_layers-data.md)
  : Information on vegetation layers
- [`veg_relation()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_relation.md)
  [`` `veg_relation<-`() ``](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/veg_relation.md)
  : Retrieve or replace relations in vegtable objects
- [`vegtable-class`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/vegtable-class.md)
  [`vegtable`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/vegtable-class.md)
  : Class vegtable.
- [`vegtable_stat()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/vegtable_stat.md)
  : General statistics from vegtable objects
- [`write_juice()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/write_juice.md)
  [`read_juice()`](http://kamapu.github.io/vegtable/reference/write_juice.md)
  : Exporting tables for Juice
